content.question: Which of the following is a left Riemann sum approximation of <math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 7, of, open parenthesis, 4 times the natural log of x, plus 2, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> with <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> subintervals of equal length?

choices.label: <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, 4 times the natural log of, open parenthesis, 1 plus, the fraction with numerator k minus 1, and denominator n, close parenthesis, plus 2, close parenthesis, times, the fraction 1 over n, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, 4 times the natural log of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator 6 k, and denominator n, close parenthesis, plus 2, close parenthesis, times, the fraction 6 over n, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, 4 times the natural log of, open parenthesis, 1 plus, the fraction with numerator 6 times, open parenthesis, k minus 1, close parenthesis, and denominator n, close parenthesis, plus 2, close parenthesis, times, the fraction 6 over n, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, 4 times the natural log of, open parenthesis, 1 plus, the fraction with numerator 6 k, and denominator n, close parenthesis, plus 2, close parenthesis, times, the fraction 6 over n, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, 4 times the natural log of, open parenthesis, 1 plus, the fraction with numerator 6 times, open parenthesis, k minus 1, close parenthesis, and denominator n, close parenthesis, plus 2, close parenthesis, times, the fraction 6 over n, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>
